text.title: Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School

head.s: Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School

p.s: Developing a strategic plan for a school begins with the alignment of the district strategic plan .
For example , one of the goals in the district strategic plan may be to improve student attendance .
Taking that goal for the school may be to improve school attendance by 2 percent over 2 years .
Usually , strategic plans are for a five year period , so the goals can reflect that as well .
Each goal that is selected for the school 's strategic plan must align with the district 's strategic plan .
The school may have fewer goals ( usually no more than three can be reached in one year ) , and each goal should have activities to support the goal as well as a budget to support the activities .
Each goal must be developed in a " shared experience " with all stakeholders ( teachers , parents , students if high school , and staff ) .
Listed in a step by step method is the process one would use to develop one of the goals in the strategic plan .

After each goal activity is completed , then the information is compiled into a comprehensive strategic plan for the school year which includes a spending plan that is aligned to the school 's total budget .

list.item:
Determine current percent of attendance .
Most elementary schools are around 95 % attendance with middle schools around 92 % , and high schools around 90 % .
Each school is provided a report of attendance reporting on a monthly basis by the District Office .

item.s: Discuss with stakeholders the current attendance rate and the need for improvement .
Discuss a 1 % increase per year for the next two years , which is aligned to the District goal .
Provide stakeholders with historic attendance reporting and indicate which months are " problematic " .
Provide stakeholders with number of students needed to make a 1 % increase .

figure.rend: Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School Step 2.jpg

item.s: Develop with stakeholders activities to meet the attendance goal of improvement by 1 % .

Examples of possible activities include monthly award assemblies for perfect attendance ( usually elementary school students ) , privilege certificates ( such as no homework for a day ) for middle and high school students , attendance clerk to monitor student attendance , and make friendly home phone calls daily for absent students , Vice Principal or other administrator may make home visits for students who have missed 3 days or more before December to determine if any interventions may be appropriate , and end-of-year trips may be tied to attendance .
These are just a few activities that schools use .
Be sure to discuss them thoroughly with all stakeholders .

figure.rend: Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School Step 3.jpg

item.s: Determine the cost of each activity and add this into the school 's budget .
Additional personnel costs may need to be approved by the district budgeting department .

figure.rend: Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School Step 4.jpg

item.s: Share the final comprehensive goal with all stakeholders in a variety of venues .
For parents and community , include the goal on the school 's website and show the results as well as activities .

figure.rend: Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School Step 5.jpg

item.s: If there is a monthly newsletter , share the goal and activities in the newsletter .
Send positive notes to students who have improved upon their attendance , and make personal telephone calls to families , thanking them for their child 's improved attendance .

During back-to-school night activities , be sure to have teaching staff discuss the importance of good attendance to student learning , and provide handouts to parents discussing the goal , the activities to reach the goal , the budget , and scientific research supporting good school attendance .
Always include all stakeholders in the process of developing the strategic plan .
Keep the planning process to a manageable level .
Stakeholders will be unable to attend many of the meetings .
Administrators must do their homework .
Be sure to get all the data together before beginning the process .

list.item:
Remember that there will always be folks against the process .
Keep a positive attitude .
Go back to the research on attendance and its importance in learning .

item.s: Educate your teachers in the planning process .
They will be your most positive supporters if they are engaged from the very beginning .
